CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 18, 1959, pg. 1, reads: "Never Invited - Although they do participate in public parks' tourneys, top-ranking tennis players in Western Pennsylvania like Billy Colbert, left, and Ike Davis, right, are never invited to play in local invitational tennis tournaments as are many of their defeated white opponents. Recently Colbert upset first-seeded winner of the Edgewood Club invitation meet, Dr. Paul Steel, in Western Pennsylvania tennis championships and moved into the semi-finals.  Colbert was not invited to play at Edgewood.  (Story and pictures on Back Page). - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of men on Schenley Park Tennis Team, from left: Bill "Billy" Colbert and Ike Davis, posed around net on tennis court
